articles.title: Index of Phrack 12
articles.historical_context: This article serves as an introduction and index for the twelfth issue of Phrack, a significant hacking ezine from the 1980s.
articles.target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and enthusiasts of hacker culture.
articles.short_summary: This article provides an overview of the contents of Phrack 12, highlighting the contributions of various authors and setting the stage for future issues.
articles.summary: In this introductory piece, Taran King reflects on the journey of Phrack Inc. over the past year and a half, expressing gratitude to contributors and readers alike. He acknowledges the delays in releasing the current issue but assures readers that the upcoming Phrack 13 will be notably different. The index lists the articles included in this issue, showcasing a variety of topics relevant to the hacking community, from technical insights to commentary on the state of hacking culture.
articles.additional_notes: This article is particularly valuable for those interested in the evolution of hacker publications and the community's dynamics during the late 1980s.

articles.title: Pro-Phile IX on Agrajag The Prolonged
articles.historical_context: This article continues the exploration of hacker personas and mythos, reflecting the culture's fascination with legendary figures.
articles.target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and those interested in hacker lore.
articles.short_summary: This article delves into the character of Agrajag, a fictional figure representing the struggles and triumphs of hackers, illustrating the community's narrative style.
articles.summary: In 'Pro-Phile IX,' Taran King presents a narrative centered around Agrajag, a character emblematic of the hacker ethos. The article weaves together anecdotes and insights that highlight the trials faced by hackers, portraying Agrajag as a symbol of resilience and ingenuity. Through this exploration, King captures the essence of hacker culture, where myth and reality intertwine, and the community's shared experiences foster a unique identity. This piece serves not only as entertainment but also as a reflection of the values and challenges inherent in the hacking world.
articles.additional_notes: Readers interested in the storytelling aspect of hacker culture will find this article particularly engaging.

articles.title: Understanding the Digital Multiplexing System (DMS)
articles.historical_context: This article provides insights into telecommunications technology, relevant to the hacking community's interests in exploiting systems.
articles.target_audience: Security professionals, telecommunications engineers, and hackers.
articles.short_summary: This article explains the Digital Multiplexing System (DMS), detailing its architecture and functionality, which is crucial for understanding telecommunication systems.
articles.summary: Control C's 'Understanding the Digital Multiplexing System (DMS)' offers a comprehensive overview of DMS technology, which plays a pivotal role in modern telecommunications. The article breaks down the architecture of DMS, explaining how it facilitates the efficient transmission of data over networks. By detailing the operational principles and components of DMS, the author equips readers with the knowledge necessary to comprehend its significance in both legitimate and illicit contexts. This technical exploration is essential for those looking to deepen their understanding of telecommunications and its vulnerabilities.
articles.additional_notes: This article is a must-read for anyone interested in the technical aspects of telecommunications and their implications for security.
